title: Dragon hide
data:
**Dragon hide** (or **dragonhide**)[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) is a [material](/wiki/Material "Material") for items that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [4 References](#References)

## Description

Dragon hide is a non-organic material that is inherently immune to [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion").

All [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scale "Dragon scale") and [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail") are made of dragon hide.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Though a [gelatinous cube](/wiki/Gelatinous_cube "Gelatinous cube") will not normally eat objects made of dragon hide, a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") in the form of a gelatinous cube can eat dragon hide objects, which breaks [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") conduct.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

[Polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling") enough dragon hide objects may result in the creation of a [straw golem](/wiki/Straw_golem "Straw golem"), which acts as a fall-through for all unlisted material types when creating a golem by polypiling.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## History

Dragon hide items are introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") with the addition of dragon scale mail, while dragon scales first appear in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Variants

Some [variants](/wiki/Variants "Variants") add new dragon scales and dragon scale mail and/or change dragon scale mail to [dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor"), while others implement an [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") system that also make it possible for certain items, usually [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather") or [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth")-based ones, to be made of dragonhide; though dragonhide-material items are distinct from dragon armor (i.e. a hero will not polymorph into a [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") if wearing dragonhide versions of normal armor), the material is the same for both.

As an object material, dragonhide is inherently fixed and [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion")-proofed as in vanilla *NetHack*, and cannot be deteriorated through normal means - it is typically highly rare and expensive, and offers the most [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") of non-metallic armor materials.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), cloth or leather items can be made of dragonhide, but do not occur randomly; they can still be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") files.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), dragonhide is also used as a "catch-all" in the code of [objnam.c](/wiki/Objnam.c "Objnam.c") for special cases involving other items made of a special leather or similar material.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) [Leo Nemaeus hide](/wiki/Leo_Nemaeus_hide "Leo Nemaeus hide") is an example of a "dragonhide" item using this special case, and is flavored as being a cloak made of skin from a [Nemean lion](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nemean_lion "wikipedia:Nemean lion").

Items with a base material of cloth or leather can very rarely generate with a dragonhide material: there is a 1⁄100 chance that a random leather item will be made of dragonhide, and a 1⁄1000 chance for cloth items to randomly generate as dragonhide. Hard objects can be made of dragonhide as well, which is described as **dragontooth** for weapons and **dragonbone** (or **dragon-bone**) otherwise. Dragonhide and dragonbone armor grants the highest bonuses to AC and [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") among materials (usually a 60% increase compared to the base material of the object), while dragonhide and dragontooth weapons gain bonuses to piercing damage.

Many [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") are made out of dragonhide, dragonbone or similar material:

- [Dragonlance](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Dragonlance "DNetHack artifacts") is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance") made of dragon-tooth.
- [Xiuhcoatl](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Xiuhcoatl "DNetHack artifacts") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") that has an [atlatl](/index.php?title=Atlatl\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Atlatl (page does not exist)") and [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip") form; the bullwhip is made of serpenthide.
- [The Lifehunt Scythe](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Lifehunt_Scythe "DNetHack artifacts") is an artifact [scythe](/wiki/Scythe "Scythe") made of dragon-tooth.
- The [Beastmaster's Duster](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Beastmaster.27s_Duster "DNetHack artifacts") is an artifact dragonhide [jacket](/wiki/Leather_jacket "Leather jacket").
- [The Platinum Dragon Plate](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Platinum_Dragon_Plate "DNetHack artifacts") is an artifact [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail"), and is made of the default dragon hide.
- The [Chromatic Dragon Scales](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon_Scales_\(dNetHack\) "Chromatic Dragon Scales (dNetHack)") are an artifact set of [black dragon scales](/wiki/Black_dragon_scales "Black dragon scales"), and are made of the default dragon hide; they can also be made into dragon scale mail or a [dragon scale shield](/wiki/Dragon_scale_shield "Dragon scale shield") like other scales.
- [The Steel Scales of Kurtulmak](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Steel_Scales_of_Kurtulmak "DNetHack artifacts"), a set of artifact [gray dragon scales](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scales "Gray dragon scales"), are made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") rather than dragon hide.

In addition to random generation, various monsters can generate with dragon-made objects:

- [Neanderthals](/wiki/Neanderthal "Neanderthal") can be generated with dragon scale mail and scale shields, alongside other dragon-made items such as dragontooth clubs or aklyses.
- [Eladrin](/wiki/Eladrin "Eladrin") that are summoned by [Dracae Eladrin](/wiki/Dracae_Eladrin "Dracae Eladrin"), and are *not* [Uiscerre Eladrin](/index.php?title=Uiscerre_Eladrin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Uiscerre Eladrin (page does not exist)"), will generate with dragontooth [long swords](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword").
- One of the [lillend](/wiki/Lillend "Lillend") created in the lair of [Lamashtu](/wiki/Lamashtu "Lamashtu") generates with a dragontooth scythe.
- Gray [intoners](/wiki/Intoner "Intoner") generate with dragontooth long swords.
- [Occultists](/index.php?title=Occultist\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Occultist (page does not exist)") generate with an inventory full of dragonbone items.
- [Mammon](/wiki/Mammon "Mammon") will generate with dragonhide and dragonbone armor.
- [Hell vaults](/wiki/Hell_vault "Hell vault") containing a [Jrt Netjer](/wiki/Jrt_Netjer "Jrt Netjer") may have dragonhide armor among its spoils.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), dragonhide is as rare and expensive as in other variants, and various cloth and leather items can rarely generate as made of dragonhide.

Like in many other variants, dragonhide objects usually cannot be deteriorated, with the exception of the revamped [destroy armor](/wiki/Destroy_armor_\(monster_spell\) "Destroy armor (monster spell)") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"). The destroy armor spell can remove a piece of armor's fixed status, including the inherent fixed property of dragonhide armor, and inflict up to three levels of erosion (which is limited to one if the target has [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance")). Artifacts are immune to erosion in this manner.

The following artifacts are made of dragonhide:

- [Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane "Dragonbane") is an artifact pair of dragonhide [gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves").
- The [Bag of the Hesperides](/wiki/Bag_of_the_Hesperides "Bag of the Hesperides") is an artifact dragonhide [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding").

## References

2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/objects.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 375](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objects.c#L375)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2411](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/eat.c#L2411)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1343](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L1343)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [dNetHack 3.21.4 objnam.c, line 1441 - special cases for dragonhide objects](https://github.com/Chris-plus-alphanumericgibberish/dNAO/blob/compat-3.21.4/src/objnam.c#L1441)

Dragon hide (or dragonhide)[1] is a material for items that appears in NetHack.

Description

All dragon scales and dragon scale mail are made of dragon hide.[2]

Polypiling enough dragon hide objects may result in the creation of a straw golem, which acts as a fall-through for all unlisted material types when creating a golem by polypiling.[4]

History

Dragon hide items are introduced in NetHack 3.0.0 with the addition of dragon scale mail, while dragon scales first appear in NetHack 3.1.0.

GruntHack

In GruntHack, cloth or leather items can be made of dragonhide, but do not occur randomly; they can still be wished for or found in bones files.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, dragonhide is also used as a "catch-all" in the code of objnam.c for special cases involving other items made of a special leather or similar material.[5] Leo Nemaeus hide is an example of a "dragonhide" item using this special case, and is flavored as being a cloak made of skin from a Nemean lion.

Items with a base material of cloth or leather can very rarely generate with a dragonhide material: there is a 1⁄100 chance that a random leather item will be made of dragonhide, and a 1⁄1000 chance for cloth items to randomly generate as dragonhide. Many artifacts are made out of dragonhide, dragonbone or similar material:

  • Dragonlance is an artifact weapon lance made of dragon-tooth.
  • Xiuhcoatl is an artifact that has an atlatl and bullwhip form; the bullwhip is made of serpenthide.
  • The Lifehunt Scythe is an artifact scythe made of dragon-tooth.
  • The Beastmaster's Duster is an artifact dragonhide jacket.
  • The Platinum Dragon Plate is an artifact silver dragon scale mail, and is made of the default dragon hide.
  • The Chromatic Dragon Scales are an artifact set of black dragon scales, and are made of the default dragon hide; they can also be made into dragon scale mail or a dragon scale shield like other scales.
  • The Steel Scales of Kurtulmak, a set of artifact gray dragon scales, are made of iron rather than dragon hide.

  • Neanderthals can be generated with dragon scale mail and scale shields, alongside other dragon-made items such as dragontooth clubs or aklyses.
  • Eladrin that are summoned by Dracae Eladrin, and are not Uiscerre Eladrin, will generate with dragontooth long swords.
  • One of the lillend created in the lair of Lamashtu generates with a dragontooth scythe.
